modules.description: Matches IPv4 and IPv6 address formats, parses URI references, and extracts authority and host components from structured strings. Operates on strings and returns matches based on defined regex patterns. Used to validate and decompose URIs in network-related processing.

Parses and validates URIs according to RFC3986, handling components like scheme, authority, path, query, and fragment. It processes strings and returns structured representations with detailed error reporting. Used to sanitize user input, extract network resources, and ensure compliance with URI standards in web-related applications.

Extracts and matches specific components of URIs using regular expressions. Operates on string data to identify IPv4 and IPv6 addresses, authority sections, and host parts. Used to validate and parse structured parts of a URI during processing.

Extracts and validates IPv4 and IPv6 addresses from URI strings, parsing references and isolating authority and host components. Processes strings using regex-based matching to decompose structured URIs into their constituent parts. Supports network-related tasks by enabling precise identification of IP addresses and URI segments. Examples include validating a URI format, isolating the host part of a reference, or checking for valid IP syntax within a query string.
